posts.name: Umar Khan
posts.cooked:
Hello Everyone,

My team just bought a new Orange Pi 5 so we can do object detection with Photonvision. The Photonvision software is running now on the Pi but when we try to use a camera nothing shows up in the camera matching tab. Our electronics person cannot find anything wrong with the connection. He has plugged in the Camera into cam1 slot and cam3 slot on the orange pi and has the ribbon cable on the “to mb” slot on the camera board. everything looks right electronically but it doesn’t seem to be showing up in the gui. anybody have this issue and see any solutions? Please let me know if any further details are needed and thanks everyone

posts.name: Sam
posts.cooked: PhotonVision only supports ribbon cables and the MIPI port on Raspberry Pi. If you’re looking for camera options, I recommend checking out quick start section of the documentation.

posts.name: Umar Khan
posts.cooked: Does that mean we can only use raspberry pi with photonvision? we saw in the documentation that it recommended orange pi for object detection models and we used a orange pi camera with a ribbon cable attached to it. is this a set up that wont work and we need to use something else?

posts.name: billbo911
posts.cooked:
PV works great on an OPi-5.  You will just have to use a USB attached camera.

To be ablevto use a CSI  camera,  you will need to be running PV on an RPi.

posts.name: Jade
posts.cooked: Which to be clear doesn’t support object detection.

posts.name: Umar Khan
posts.cooked: Thanks for the help guys. Just to make sure i’m clear on this. Using a usb camera with the orange pi 5 is the only way i am able to run object detection?

posts.name: tkchan
posts.cooked: Yes, you also probably wanted to make sure you are getting and using the USB cameras with Global Shutter on them.  Please check the PV full documentations on HW, sample configurations, etc.  Think there’s couple other threads on here that has a lot of discussions already.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: think outside of the box from time to time

posts.custom_user_title: think outside of the box from time to time

posts.name: Sam
posts.cooked: At present yes, there may be other supported platforms sometime in the future.
